Package main.java

Class HttpServer

java.lang.Object
main.java.HttpServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class HttpServer extends Object implements Closeable
An implementation of an HTTP server.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    HttpServer(int port)
    Constructs an HTTP server that listens for HTTP requests on the input port.

      Returns:
      the content type associated with the given URI, or null if the file type is not supported.

    • getEntityHeaders

      version - the version of the HTTP server
      Returns:
      the HTTP server response entity headers

    • getEntityHeaders

      public static String[] getEntityHeaders(String serverName, String version, long length, String contentType)
      Returns the HTTP server response entity headers.
      Parameters:
      serverName - the name of the HTTP server
      version - the version of the HTTP server
      length - the content length of the requested resource, or 0 if the resource does not exist.
      contentType - the content type of the requested file, or null if the content type is unsupported.
      Returns:
      the HTTP server response entity headers

      version - the version of the HTTP server
      statusCode - the status code of the request
      Returns:

    • getResponseHeader

      public static String getResponseHeader(String serverName, String version, int statusCode, String uri)
      Returns the HTTP server response header.
      Parameters:
      serverName - the name of the HTTP server
      version - the version of the HTTP server
      statusCode - the status code of the request
      uri - the path identifier for the requested resource, or null if the URI was not provided
      Returns:
      the HTTP server response header

    • getStatusCode

      public static int getStatusCode(String domain, int port, String request)
      Returns the status code for the input HTTP request. The request must include a HOST field in its header. Valid hosts are 'localhost', '127.0.0.1', and the machine's domain name, and it must be appended with the HTTP server's designated port unless the port is 80.
      Parameters:
      domain - the domain name of the HTTP server
      port - the port of the HTTP server
      request - the HTTP request
      Returns:
      the status code for the input HTTP request

    • getStatusLine

      public static String getStatusLine(int statusCode)
      Returns the HTTP server response status line.
      Parameters:
      statusCode - the status code of the request
      Returns:
      the HTTP server response status line
